meanings.sent1: I put the cookies in a boite to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry was stored in a beautiful boite on the dresser.
meanings.sent3: The tiny boite held a surprise gift for the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a boite of memories, each one precious and fragile.
meanings.sent5: The boite was so small, it could fit in the palm of my hand.

meanings.sent1: We had a great time dancing at the boite last night.
meanings.sent2: The boite was filled with music and laughter.
meanings.sent3: The boite was so crowded, it felt like a party in a box.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the boite like a joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: The neon lights outside the boite beckoned us to come in and dance.

meanings.definition: To box or fight with fists.
meanings.sent1: He learned how to boite from his older brother.
meanings.sent2: The two friends decided to boite for fun in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: They playfully boited each other, laughing all the while.
meanings.sent4: In the ring, the champion boited his opponent with skill and precision.
meanings.sent5: The siblings would often boite over who got to use the TV remote.
